vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(c / a == b, "SafeMath: multiplication overflow");
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(delay_ >= MINIMUM_DELAY, "Timelock::constructor: Delay must exceed minimum delay.");

vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(msg.sender == address(this), "Timelock::setDelay: Call must come from Timelock.");

vulnerability_findings.name: use-short-revert-string
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(c / a == b, "SafeMath: multiplication overflow");
vulnerability_findings.message: Shortening revert strings to fit in 32 bytes will decrease gas costs for deployment and  gas costs when the revert condition has been met.

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.message: Timelock.setDelay (Timelock.sol#202-209) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.message: Timelock.acceptAdmin (Timelock.sol#211-217) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.message: Timelock.setPendingAdmin (Timelock.sol#219-224) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.message: Timelock.queueTransaction (Timelock.sol#226-235) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.message: Timelock.cancelTransaction (Timelock.sol#237-244) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
vulnerability_findings.message: Timelock.executeTransaction (Timelock.sol#246-271) should be declared external

vulnerability_findings.name: solc-version
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: pragma solidity ^0.5.16;
vulnerability_findings.message:
Detected issues with version pragma in Timelock.sol:
	- pragma solidity^0.5.16 (Timelock.sol#3): it allows old versions
	- pragma solidity^0.5.16 (Timelock.sol#169): it allows old versions

vulnerability_findings.name: low-level-calls
vulnerability_findings.message:
Low level call in Timelock.executeTransaction (Timelock.sol#246-271):
	-(success,returnData) = target.call.value(value)(callData) Timelock.sol#265
